content.description: Start in a wide gulley/chimney type feature underneath a roof. After a few moves, step right underneath the roof and move up to a ledge and then the belay/summit.
content.protection: Anchors are either the bleached snag on the left or a slung block on the right. A 40m rope is plenty for the rap. A set of nuts and single cams from 0.3 - 1 will suffice.
content.location: Twenty feet left of the Classic Route, starting right where the ridge line meets the summit block.

content.description: Climb up and left toward the anchors (block with tat and rings) shared with the "Roof" route.
content.protection: Big cracks for #3 or #4 BD cams but not much else.  Slung block at the top shared with the "classic" route.
content.location: Start at two wide, left-leaning cracks about 50' to the right of the base of the classic route.

content.description: One easy blocky low-fifth class pitch up the summit block/Unicorn's horn. There is a fixed pin in the middle of the pitch. Fun in mixed/early season conditions. Belay and rap off the old bleached snag (still solid ... for now)
content.protection: One fixed pin. A single set of nuts will suffice. A 30m rope is adequate for the lead and the rap. Also very reasonable to do as a solo.
content.location: The S-SE face of the summit block
